subject: SV: [junit] Swingui TesterRunner can not call EJB?
msgSnippet: ... or use the switch -noloading : java junit.swingui.TestRunner -noloading kind regards Hardy Henneberg
messageBody:
... or use the switch -noloading : 'java junit.swingui.TestRunner
-noloading'

kind regards
Hardy Henneberg

> -----Oprindelig meddelelse-----
> Fra: Arco van den Heuvel [SMTP:arco@...]
> Sendt: 23. marts 2001 20:57
> Til: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Emne: RE: [junit] Swingui TesterRunner can not call EJB?
>
>
> The JUnit TestRunner is, by default, in loading mode. That is, modified
> classes are reloaded, when runnning the test.
> This causes problems when using EJBs in the test cases. A
> ClassCastException occurs with the EJB implementation. Different
> classloaders are used for the EJB in the test case and the EJB in the
> application server. To overcome this problem, disable the loading property
> in the junit.properties file.
>
> Add a junit.properties file for preference settings. It is stored in the
> folder referred to by the "user.home" property. The supported setting is
> loading, it can be set to true or false to enable or disable the loading
> behavior.
>
> On Windows 2000, "user.home" could be C:\Documents and Settings\user
> A drawback to disabling the loading behavior, is that modified test cases
> will require JUnit to be restarted.
>
> Find attached a sample junit.properties file.
>
>
> Arco.
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: peaceluck@... [ <mailto:peaceluck@...>]
> Sent: Friday, March 23, 2001 2:14 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Swingui TesterRunner can not call EJB?
>
>
> We are trying to call EJB in our JUnit, it runs fine normally,
> however, if we run it from the TesterRunner of swingui, the
> PortableRemoteObject.narrow() method throws a ClassCastException.
>
> Anyone has experienced this problem?
>
>
